meanings.definition: To mark with points or dots between.
meanings.sent1: She carefully interpointed the sentences with dots.
meanings.sent2: Please interpoint the items on the list with dots.
meanings.sent3: The teacher interpointed the words on the board playfully.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness interpointed every interaction with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the sky seemed to interpoint the darkness with light.

meanings.definition: A point or dot used to separate items in a list or text.
meanings.sent1: The interpoint on the page helped organize the information.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use an interpoint to separate the paragraphs.
meanings.sent3: The interpoint on the sign was small but effective.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was like an interpoint in the serious meeting.
meanings.sent5: The interpoint on the map guided us to our destination.

meanings.definition: To connect or relate points or ideas.
meanings.sent1: She tried to interpoint the different theories in her essay.
meanings.sent2: Interpoint the concepts to show their relationship.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to interpoint the jokes fell flat.
meanings.sent4: Music has a way of interpointing emotions and memories.
meanings.sent5: Her stories interpointed past and present seamlessly.
